New Records: The Angels set a franchise record for losses with 96 losses
Key Match Events: The White Sox swept the Angels in three games
The White Sox scored their season-high 7 runs in the fifth inning
Shortstop Zach Neto left the game with right shoulder irritation
Post-Match Reflections: Angels catcher Logan O'Hoppe said the record is what it is, but the team doesn't feel like what the record shows
Manager Ron Washington said the team has no choice but to be optimistic that they can improve next year
Shortstop Zach Neto said the loss is a learning step for the team
Miscellaneous Highlights: The White Sox began the series with an MLB-tying worst 120 losses
The Angels lost 95 games in 1968 and 1980
Left-hander Tyler Anderson ended his season with a 3.81 ERA in 31 starts
Others: The Angels are going to need Anderson to rediscover his first-half form, and get a few other pitchers to join him, if the Angels are to bounce back from this nightmarish season
